name: Largest k < n such that gcd(k,n) > 1 and rad(k) does not divide n, where rad = A007947, or 0 if k does not exist.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = 0 for n = 6, and n in A000961.
For n > 6 in A024619, a(n) is the last term in row n of A272619.
mathematica: rad[x_] := rad[x] = Times @@ FactorInteger[x][[All, 1]]; {0}~Join~Table[If[Nor[PrimePowerQ[n], n == 6], k = n - 2; While[Or[CoprimeQ[n, k], Divisible[n, rad[k]]], k--]; k, 0], {n, 2, 120}]
author: _Michael De Vlieger_, Apr 04 2025
